title:
Emergence of quadrupolar order under magnetic field in $5d^2$ double
  perovskites
authors: Stashu Kozlowski, Derek Churchill, Hae-Young Kee
abstract:
Motivated by the time-reversal symmetry breaking signal in muon spin
relaxation below a transition temperature without accompanying noticeable
magnetic Bragg peaks in $5d^2$ Os double perovskites, a rare ferro-octupolar
order was proposed to account for such hidden order. Here we study the phase
transitions under a magnetic field in triangular and face-centered cubic
lattices using classical Monte Carlo simulations. It is expected that
higher-rank moments do not couple linearly to the magnetic field. Consequently,
a field applied along the ferro-octupolar order is not anticipated to influence
the ordering. However, we observe the emergence of antiferro-quadrupolar
ordering mixed with the antiferro-octupolar order (AFQO) due to the
field-induced bond-dependent exchange interaction. This field-linear
interaction among non-Kramer doublets arises via the coupling to the excited
triplet states enabled by the external field. In the triangular lattice, we
uncover intriguing vortex states, which could inspire future research into
$5d^2$ triangular lattice systems.
